events.title: Sack of Rome by the Vandals
events.description: The Vandals, led by King Genseric, entered Rome and sacked the city, causing extensive destruction and marking one of the significant events in the decline of the Western Roman Empire.
events.significance: This event symbolized the vulnerability of Rome and accelerated the decline of the Western Roman Empire.

events.title: Decembrist Revolt in Russia
events.description: Russian army officers led about 3,000 soldiers in a protest against Tsar Nicholas I's assumption of the throne after his elder brother Constantine's abdication.
events.significance: Though the rebellion was suppressed, it marked the beginning of a movement toward governmental reform and influenced future revolutionary activities in Russia.

events.title: Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II
events.description: Elizabeth II was crowned Queen of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms at Westminster Abbey in London.
events.significance: Her coronation marked the beginning of the longest reign in British history and significant changes in the monarchy's role during modern times.

events.title: Italy Referendum on Constitutional Reform
events.description: Italy held a referendum on constitutional reforms proposed by Prime Minister Matteo Renzi, which was rejected by the majority of voters, leading to Renzi's resignation.
events.significance: The rejection reflected the public's resistance to political reforms and caused a shift in Italy's political landscape.
